item.title: Second Brain for CS
item.description: Navigation § Homepage is still under development. You can navigate around the notes using the explorer on the left side or visit the list of tags that categories the notes.

item.title: terraform-docs
item.description: #terraform Abstract § Auto-generate README.MD for each module Github Example § Bash script that generates the modules README.MD automatically #! /bin/bash terraform-docs markdown table --output-file README.

item.title: Terraform tfvars File (terraform.tfvars)
item.description: #terraform Abstract § The recommended way to pass variables into Terraform Terraform auto loads tfvars files only when they are named terraform.tfvars or terraform.

item.title: Terraform
item.description: #terraform Terraform Installation Injecting values into file dynamically § User Data example Dependencies § When some resources need to use other resources’ info.

item.title: Terraform Paths
item.description: #terraform ${path.module} § Gives the relative path to the Terraform Module Allows us to call call files inside the module while we are executing terraform apply in the root module directory .

item.title: Terraform Template File (.tpl)
item.description: #terraform Passing 4 variables to the .tpl file user_data = base64encode(templatefile("./userdata.tpl", { kms_key = aws_kms_key.vault.id, vault_url = "https://releases.

item.title: Terraform Best Practices
item.description: #terraform Referece General style and structure guidelines § 1. Follow a standard module structure § Use terraform-docs to automate the process of generating README.

item.title: Terraform Functions
item.description: #terraform Examples (Functions I used before) § Note base64encode Applies Base64 encoding to a string Note filebase64sha256 Hash the content of the given file & encodes it with Base 64 Note base64sha256 Computes the SHA256 hash of a given string & encodes it with Base 64 Reference All Terraform Functions .

item.title: Terraform Loops
item.description: Abstract § Use Array elements as map keys § output "aws_lb_target_group_attachment" { value = { for subnet_id in toset(module.networking.private_subnet_ids) : subnet_id => module.
